On 10/18/05, Jeff Grigg <jeffgrigg@...> wrote:
> Yes, I think that =
every test needs a meaningful name.  Technically,
> a "moniker."  Given the=
 name/moniker of a failing test, it should be
> possible to automatically r=
ecreate and rerun just that test.  That is,
> from "testThis(3 of 10)" or "=
testThis(5,'hello',true)", it should be
> possible to construct and run a t=
est instance equivalent to the
> original.  (And I'm saying "should" in the=
 sense of, "The tool would
> be most useful if it did things this way.")

W=
ell... in most GUI JUnit runners (like the ones inside IDEs), you can
just =
click on the failing test and re-run it directly. This is
possible because =
JUnit uses seperate instances per test (mild dig at
Cedric) - as such, a mo=
niker isn't strictly necessary (though it
wouldn't hurt).
